hero.headline: Find Relief, Understand Your Cycle.
hero.subheadline: Your compassionate guide to navigating menstrual pain with effective solutions and supportive resources.
hero.bodyCopy: Welcome to periodhub.health – your trusted partner for menstrual wellness. We offer evidence-based insights, practical tools, and compassionate support to help you understand, manage, and find relief from menstrual discomfort. Whether you need quick remedies, long-term strategies, or a deeper understanding of your body, we're here for you.

immediateReliefPage.title: Immediate Relief Solutions for Period Pain
immediateReliefPage.description: Explore quick and effective methods to find relief from period pain when you need it most. Learn about techniques you can apply right now.
immediateReliefPage.introText: When period pain strikes, you need fast, effective ways to find comfort. This section is dedicated to immediate relief solutions – methods you can turn to right now to help alleviate acute menstrual cramps and discomfort.
immediateReliefPage.introText2: We understand that finding quick relief is essential for getting through your day. The approaches suggested here focus on readily available techniques and remedies that can provide temporary but much-needed comfort.
immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText: Experimentation is key to discovering which immediate relief methods are most effective for your unique body and pain type. Consider combining different approaches for enhanced comfort.
immediateReliefPage.findingWhatWorksText2: Remember, these methods are for managing symptoms in the moment. For persistent, severe, or unusual pain, always consult a healthcare professional.
immediateReliefPage.heatTherapyDescription: Applying heat to the lower abdomen or back can help relax contracting uterine muscles and improve blood circulation, which may alleviate cramps.
immediateReliefPage.gentleMovementDescription: Light stretching, walking, or specific yoga poses can sometimes ease cramps by improving circulation and muscle relaxation. Deep breathing techniques can also help manage pain.
immediateReliefPage.breathingExerciseDescription: Activate the parasympathetic nervous system through 4-7-8 breathing technique to naturally reduce pain sensitivity. Research shows it can reduce pain perception by 40%.
immediateReliefPage.acupressureDescription: Applying pressure to specific points on the body may help reduce pain signals and provide relief from menstrual cramps.
immediateReliefPage.otcOptionsDescription: Understanding common non-prescription options and their basic mechanisms can be helpful, although professional medical advice is crucial for safe and effective use.
immediateReliefPage.workTipsTitle: Quick Tips for Managing Cramps at Work
immediateReliefPage.workTipsDescription: Practical strategies for finding relief during your workday when period pain strikes.
immediateReliefPage.meditationDescription: A quick guided meditation practice designed specifically to help manage menstrual pain.
immediateReliefPage.disclaimerText: The information provided on this page is for educational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always seek the advice of your physician or other qualified health provider with any questions you may have regarding a medical condition.

heatTherapy.frequency: As needed, up to 3-4 times daily
heatTherapy.timing: At onset of pain, continue for 2-3 days
heatTherapy.mechanism: Increases blood flow, relaxes uterine muscles

breathing.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Parameters
breathing.cycles: Start with 3-4 cycles, increase to 8 cycles
breathing.mechanism: Activates parasympathetic nervous system, reduces prostaglandin sensitivity

nsaid.title: NSAID Usage Parameters
nsaid.timing: Start at first sign of cramps, continue for 1-2 days
nsaid.contraindications: Avoid with asthma, ulcers, kidney disease

culturalCharmsPage.title: Exploring Cultural Comfort: Charms and Traditional Healing Symbols
culturalCharmsPage.description: Explore the historical and cultural significance of charms, symbols, and traditional practices used for comfort and spiritual support.
culturalCharmsPage.introText: Throughout history and across diverse cultures, people have turned to symbols, objects, and traditional practices for comfort, protection, and support during times of vulnerability, including during menstruation. These practices are deeply rooted in cultural belief systems and folklore.
culturalCharmsPage.understandingText: Many cultures have traditions that involve using specific items or performing certain rituals believed to influence well-being, bring good fortune, or ward off negative energy. For some, this extends to seeking comfort or relief during challenging physical experiences like menstrual discomfort.
culturalCharmsPage.disclaimerText: The information presented here regarding cultural charms, traditional practices, and associated beliefs is for cultural and informational purposes only. These practices are rooted in tradition and belief systems and are not intended to be, and should not be interpreted as, a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

q1.question: What are the fastest ways to relieve menstrual cramps?
q1.answer: The fastest menstrual cramp relief methods include: heat therapy on lower abdomen and back, gentle abdominal massage, light exercise like yoga, NSAIDs like ibuprofen, and adequate rest. Combining multiple methods works best.

q2.question: What is considered a normal menstrual cycle?
q2.answer: A normal menstrual cycle ranges from 21-35 days, with an average of 28 days. Menstruation typically lasts 3-7 days. Consult a gynecologist if cycles are consistently irregular.

q3.question: How does Traditional Chinese Medicine treat irregular periods?
q3.answer: TCM treats irregular periods through syndrome differentiation: acupuncture to regulate qi and blood, herbal formulas, dietary therapy, and lifestyle adjustments. Professional TCM diagnosis is needed for personalized treatment.

meta.title: Understanding Menstrual Pain - Health Guide
meta.description: Deep dive into the causes, types, and physiological mechanisms of menstrual pain, master the scientific foundation of menstrual pain knowledge.

hero.title: Understanding Menstrual Pain
hero.description: Deep dive into the causes, types, and physiological mechanisms of menstrual pain to lay a scientific foundation for effective management.

whatIsPain.title: What is Menstrual Pain?
whatIsPain.description1: Dysmenorrhea refers to lower abdominal pain, cramping, or discomfort that occurs during or around menstruation. It is one of the most common gynecological symptoms, affecting approximately 80% of women of reproductive age worldwide.
whatIsPain.description2: The severity of menstrual pain varies from person to person, ranging from mild discomfort to severe pain that significantly impacts daily life. Understanding the nature of menstrual pain is the first step in developing effective management strategies.

primary.title: Primary Dysmenorrhea
primary.description: Primary dysmenorrhea is the most common type, usually appearing shortly after the onset of puberty. This pain is caused by uterine contractions and has no underlying pathological cause.
symptoms: Usually appears 1-2 days before menstruation begins
Pain concentrated in lower abdomen and lower back
May be accompanied by nausea, vomiting, diarrhea

secondary.title: Secondary Dysmenorrhea
secondary.description: Secondary dysmenorrhea is caused by underlying gynecological conditions, usually appearing in adulthood or when existing pain suddenly worsens. Requires medical evaluation and treatment.

prostaglandins.title: Role of Prostaglandins
prostaglandins.description: Prostaglandins are the primary biochemical factors causing menstrual pain. During menstruation, the endometrium releases large amounts of prostaglandins, particularly PGF2α and PGE2, which cause strong uterine muscle contractions, compress blood vessels, reduce blood flow, and thus generate pain.

painPathways.title: Pain Transmission Pathways
painPathways.description: Menstrual pain signals are transmitted through the sympathetic nervous system to the spinal cord and then to the brain. This process involves multiple neurotransmitters and receptors, including endorphins and serotonin, which explains why certain treatments (such as exercise and meditation) can effectively relieve pain.

tcmAnalysis.title: Traditional Chinese Medicine Analysis
tcmAnalysis.description: Based on symptom characteristics, Traditional Chinese Medicine categorizes menstrual pain into several main syndrome types, each with unique pathological mechanisms and treatment approaches:

qiStagnation.title: Qi Stagnation and Blood Stasis
qiStagnation.mainSymptoms: Distending pain, stabbing pain, dark menstrual blood with clots
qiStagnation.treatmentPrinciple: Soothe liver qi, activate blood circulation

coldCoagulation.title: Cold Coagulation and Blood Stasis
coldCoagulation.mainSymptoms: Cold pain, cramping pain, relieved by warmth
coldCoagulation.treatmentPrinciple: Warm meridians, dispel cold, activate blood

qiBloodDeficiency.title: Qi and Blood Deficiency
qiBloodDeficiency.mainSymptoms: Dull pain, bearing-down pain, likes pressure
qiBloodDeficiency.treatmentPrinciple: Tonify qi and blood, regulate menstruation

liverKidneyDeficiency.title: Liver and Kidney Deficiency
liverKidneyDeficiency.mainSymptoms: Soreness in lower back and knees, irregular periods
liverKidneyDeficiency.painCharacteristics: Dull continuous pain, likes warmth and pressure
liverKidneyDeficiency.treatmentPrinciple: Tonify liver and kidney, regulate menstruation

riskFactors.title: Risk Factors
riskFactors.description: Understanding risk factors for menstrual pain helps with prevention and early intervention:
factors: Age: Adolescent and young women are more prone to menstrual pain
Family history: Women with a family history of menstrual pain have higher risk
Lifestyle: Lack of exercise, high stress, irregular diet
Weight: Being underweight or overweight can increase risk
Smoking: Smoking can worsen menstrual pain symptoms

whenToSeekHelp.title: When to Seek Medical Help
whenToSeekHelp.description: While most menstrual pain is normal, certain situations require prompt medical attention:
warningSigns: Sudden worsening or change in pain nature
Accompanied by fever, nausea, vomiting or other severe symptoms

prevention.title: Prevention Measures
prevention.description: Through lifestyle adjustments, menstrual pain can be effectively prevented and reduced:
measures: Balanced diet, reduce caffeine and sugar intake
Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol consumption

callToAction.description: Understanding menstrual pain is the first step in management. Next, we'll provide you with more practical solutions.

commute.title: Commute Scenario Solutions
commute.description: Encountering period discomfort during your commute? Here are the most practical emergency strategies and discreet relief techniques to help you handle it confidently on crowded subways, buses, and ride-hailing services.

invisibleHeatSystem.name: Invisible Heat System
invisibleHeatSystem.usage: Apply to abdomen or lower back, continuous heat for 6 hours

gingerTeaSachets.name: Ginger Tea Sachets
gingerTeaSachets.usage: Mix with warm water, relieves cramps

strategies: Priority seat smart application (period electronic certificate)
Wall pelvic support method: slightly bend knees against carriage wall
Wear noise-canceling headphones with 432Hz pain relief audio
Seat heating + lumbar air cushion (auto inflate/deflate every 30 min)
Avoid forced driving during pain (reaction speed decreases 30%)
Silicone seat cover (shock absorption + constant temperature)
Abdominal belt for core stability (prevent riding sway)

acupressure.title: Subway/Bus Acupressure Techniques
acupressure.description: In crowded spaces, these simple and easy-to-learn acupressure techniques can quickly relieve pain during commuting.

hegu.name: Hegu Point
hegu.location: Tiger mouth area, between thumb and index finger
hegu.benefits: Soothes liver qi, promotes blood circulation, highly versatile
hegu.technique: Press and rub with thumb or index finger pad, moderate pressure
hegu.commuteUse: Perform discreetly under bag or clothing, use handrails or backrests for assistance
hegu.userQuote: "The subway is already exhausting, and when period pain hits, it's just adding insult to injury. I just want to get home and lie down."

neiguan.name: Neiguan Point
neiguan.location: Inner side of wrist, about three fingers width from wrist crease
neiguan.benefits: Relieves nausea, irritability and other accompanying symptoms, regulates emotions
neiguan.technique: Press with thumb, can use intermittent or continuous pressure
neiguan.commuteUse: Can be done while holding handrails, very discreet
neiguan.userQuote: "Stomach pain while driving affects concentration and feels dangerous. But I can't just stop anywhere."

taichong.name: Taichong Point
taichong.location: Top of foot, about one finger width up between big toe and second toe
taichong.benefits: Soothes liver qi, promotes qi circulation and pain relief, specifically for mood swings
taichong.technique: Remove shoes, press with thumb, coordinate with deep breathing
taichong.commuteUse: Suitable when sitting, can quietly remove shoes and press while seated
taichong.userQuote: "Pressing Taichong point on the subway made me feel much calmer emotionally, and the pain was also reduced."

breathingTechniques.title: Driving Breathing Relaxation Methods
breathingTechniques.description: Driving requires high concentration, and period pain can be distracting. Learn these simple breathing techniques to help relieve discomfort while driving and ensure safety.

boxBreathing.name: Box Breathing
boxBreathing.description: 4-4-4-4 rhythm, helps regulate autonomic nervous system
steps: Inhale 4 seconds (belly rises)
Hold breath 4 seconds
Exhale 4 seconds (belly falls)
Hold breath 4 seconds, repeat cycle
boxBreathing.benefits: Reduces heart rate and stress, relieves muscle tension
boxBreathing.safetyTip: Only practice fully when stopped at red lights or safely parked

diaphragmaticBreathing.name: Diaphragmatic Breathing
diaphragmaticBreathing.description: Focus on abdominal movement, promotes blood circulation
steps: One hand on chest, one hand on abdomen
When inhaling, abdominal hand rises, chest hand stays still
When exhaling, abdominal hand falls
Maintain slow, deep breathing rhythm
diaphragmaticBreathing.benefits: Increases oxygen supply, relieves abdominal cramps
diaphragmaticBreathing.safetyTip: Can be done while driving, but attention must remain on road conditions

scientificBasis.title: Scientific Basis
scientificBasis.content: Deep breathing exercises regulate the autonomic nervous system, reducing heart rate and stress response, relieving muscle tension. Research shows that regular breathing exercises can promote endorphin release, the body's natural painkillers.

safetyTips.title: Safety Tips
tips: Medication carrying: Ibuprofen should be carried in original packaging to avoid security questions
Privacy protection: Use compartment boxes to store sanitary products, avoid exposure
Data recording: When commute pain occurs, use app to record "pain start time + transport mode"
No driving during severe pain: When severe pain affects driving safety, must immediately pull over to rest or seek help

emergencyKit.title: Multi-Scenario Period Emergency Kit List
emergencyKit.description: Handle with confidence, live comfortably: You're not fighting period discomfort alone. This list provides emergency preparation and item suggestions for various scenarios, helping you handle any situation with confidence and control your state.

teenSection.title: 🌸 New Teen Section Added!
teenSection.subtitle: Campus emergency kit designed for girls aged 12-18
teenSection.description: We've specially added a campus emergency kit list for our teen friends! From classroom emergencies to dorm management, from communicating with teachers to peer support, comprehensive help for confidently handling periods in campus environments.

importantNotice.title: Important Notice
importantNotice.content: The suggestions in this list are auxiliary relief measures. If you experience severe period pain or other abnormal symptoms, please seek medical attention promptly. Use of pain medications should be under the guidance of a doctor or pharmacist.

teen.name: Teen/Campus
teen.description: Campus emergency kit designed specifically for teens aged 12-18, helping handle period discomfort confidently in school, dorm, and other environments.

miniHeatPatches.name: Mini Heat Patches/Hand Warmers
miniHeatPatches.usage: Apply to abdomen or lower back for warmth anytime, anywhere. Compact size allows discreet use without attracting classmates' attention. Especially suitable for classroom use.
miniHeatPatches.tip: Choose products with long-lasting, constant temperature heat. Use over clothing to avoid burns. Can apply before going to school.

painMedication.name: Pain Medication (With Parental Consent)
painMedication.usage: Carry safe pain medication with parental consent and guidance. Take when body first feels discomfort for effective, quick pain relief.
painMedication.tip: Must use under parental or medical guidance. Understand dosage and timing. Do not share medication with classmates.

hotWaterBottle.name: Hot Water Bottle/Thermos
hotWaterBottle.usage: Communicate with school about using during particularly difficult periods. Replenish warm water anytime to help relieve bloating and muscle tension.
hotWaterBottle.tip: Choose cups with good insulation. Can use during breaks or lunch. If school doesn't allow, drink warm water at water stations during breaks.

smallSnacks.name: Small Snacks (Chocolate/Candy)
smallSnacks.usage: A piece of chocolate or small candy can help distract attention and provide energy. Eat when feeling tired or down.
smallSnacks.tip: Choose individually packaged for easy carrying. Don't eat during class, enjoy during breaks or lunch.

spareClothing.name: Comfortable Spare Clothing
spareClothing.usage: Prepare a loose jacket or scarf for when feeling cold or needing extra warmth. Can also provide psychological comfort when abdomen feels uncomfortable.
spareClothing.tip: Choose colors and styles that are easy to match. Can keep in dorm or locker as backup.

communicationCards.name: Communication Cards/Notes
communicationCards.usage: Prepare simple notes in advance, like "I'm not feeling well, may I go to the nurse's office?" for use when too shy to speak up.
communicationCards.tip: Can prepare Chinese and English versions. Also communicate with trusted classmates or teachers in advance to build understanding and support.

office.name: Office/Workplace
office.description: Facing sudden period pain in the office requires quick, convenient methods that don't affect work.

miniHeatPatches.name: Mini Heat Patches/Hand Warmers
miniHeatPatches.usage: Apply to abdomen or lower back. Provides continuous warmth, relaxes muscles, relieves cramps. Compact size for discreet use.
miniHeatPatches.tip: Choose products with long-lasting, constant temperature heat. Use over clothing to avoid low-temperature burns.

painMedication.name: Portable Pain Medication
painMedication.usage: Take when body first feels discomfort. Effectively relieves pain quickly. Must carry and use under doctor or pharmacist guidance.
painMedication.tip: Understand dosage, timing, and possible side effects. Do not increase dosage without authorization.

gingerTea.name: Brown Sugar Ginger Tea/Instant Warm Drinks
gingerTea.usage: Brew with hot water in tea room. Warm drinks help promote blood circulation, relieve bloating and cold stagnation.
gingerTea.tip: Choose individually packaged for easy carrying and brewing.

massageTools.name: Compact Massage Tools
massageTools.usage: Gently massage waist and hand acupoints while in office chair or resting. Distracts attention, relieves local muscle tension.
massageTools.tip: No large movements needed, can be done under clothing.

commute.name: Commute
commute.description: Encountering period discomfort on the road, especially on public transport, requires quick, discreet emergency methods.

miniHandWarmers.name: Mini Hand Warmers
miniHandWarmers.usage: Apply before departure. Provides long-term warmth, especially suitable for long periods of standing or sitting during commute.
miniHandWarmers.tip: Ensure good adhesion and won't fall off easily.

warmWater.name: Small Bottle of Warm Water or Thermos
warmWater.usage: Replenish fluids anytime, sip warm water. Warm water helps relieve bloating and muscle tension.
warmWater.tip: Especially important in winter. If inconvenient on transport, replenish before boarding or after alighting.

headphones.name: Headphones
headphones.usage: Listen to soothing music, white noise, or podcasts. Distracts attention, calms emotions.
headphones.tip: Try soothing audio recommended in sound therapy.

exercise.name: Exercise/Outdoor
exercise.description: Moderate exercise during menstruation is beneficial for health, but encountering pain during exercise or outdoor environments requires special preparation and response.

windproofJacket.name: Lightweight Windproof Jacket
windproofJacket.usage: Put on immediately after sweating from exercise to avoid catching cold. Especially important in outdoor environments.
windproofJacket.tip: Catching cold may worsen pain. Choose breathable, moisture-wicking professional sportswear.

hygieneProducts.name: Personal Hygiene Products (Sports-specific)
hygieneProducts.usage: Such as sports sanitary pads/tampons/menstrual cups. Ensure leak protection and comfort during exercise.
hygieneProducts.tip: Choose appropriate products based on exercise intensity and personal flow.

water.name: Adequate Drinking Water/Electrolyte Drinks
water.usage: Replenish fluids and electrolytes during exercise. Avoid dehydration, helps body maintain normal function, partially relieves fatigue and cramps.
water.tip: Warm water is better. Avoid exercising on an empty stomach.

sleep.name: Sleep
sleep.description: Nighttime period pain can seriously affect sleep, good preparation helps ensure restful sleep.

heatingItems.name: Hot Water Bottle/Electric Blanket/Hand Warmers
heatingItems.usage: Apply to abdomen or lower back before sleep. Provides continuous warmth, relaxes abdominal muscles, significantly relieves cramping pain.
heatingItems.tip: Pay attention to temperature to avoid burns. Electric blankets/hot water bottles require safe use. Hand warmers are suitable for all-night use.

bodyPillow.name: Body Pillow or Cushion
bodyPillow.usage: Place under knees or hug while sleeping (with left side lying). Helps body maintain comfortable position, reduces abdominal pressure.
bodyPillow.tip: Try placing a pillow between legs or under abdomen for support.

sleepAudio.name: Bedtime Sleep Audio
sleepAudio.usage: Play before sleep to regulate nerves, distract from pain, help relax and fall asleep.
sleepAudio.tip: Can wear comfortable headphones. Choose moderate volume, calm content audio.

social.name: Social
social.description: When participating in social activities (such as dates, parties, dining out) while dealing with period discomfort, requires clever handling and advance preparation.

miniHandWarmers.name: Mini Hand Warmers
miniHandWarmers.usage: Apply before going out. Provides continuous warmth, not easily noticed by others.
miniHandWarmers.tip: Choose compact products with good adhesion.

comfortableClothing.name: Comfortable and Movement-friendly Clothing
comfortableClothing.usage: Choose clothing that doesn't constrict the abdomen while allowing for discreet small adjustments.

scarf.name: Small Comfortable Scarf or Shawl
scarf.usage: Use in air-conditioned environments or when feeling cold. Protects abdomen and waist.
scarf.tip: Serves as both accessory and provides warmth and security.

summary.title: Summary and Recommendations
summary.content: This list provides a basic framework. The specific emergency kit contents and preparation methods can be adjusted according to your personal situation, pain level, lifestyle habits, and specific environment. Most importantly:

tips.title: Know your body:
tips.content: Pay attention to the patterns and characteristics of menstrual pain.

tips.title: Prepare in advance:
tips.content: Be prepared, make emergency items a regular part of your bag.

tips.title: Listen to your body:
tips.content: Don't push through, if pain seriously affects normal life, seek rest or medical help promptly.

tips.title: Seek help bravely:
tips.content: When needed, tell family, friends, or trusted people about your discomfort to gain their understanding and support.

tips.title: Special reminder for teens:
tips.content: If you're a 12-18 year old student, remember to communicate with parents about emergency kit preparation, and bravely seek help from teachers or school nurses when facing difficulties at school.

summary.conclusion: Hope this list helps you face various life scenarios with more confidence and comfort during your period!

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: The suggestions in this list are for informational reference only and cannot replace professional medical diagnosis, treatment, or advice. Please follow doctor or pharmacist guidance for medication use. Individual situations vary, please adjust according to your own feelings. If your menstrual pain is severe and unbearable, or accompanied by other abnormal symptoms (such as fever, severe vomiting, abnormal bleeding, etc.), please seek medical attention immediately.

office.title: Office Scenario Solutions
office.description: Facing sudden period pain in the office requires quick, convenient methods that don't affect work.

coreEquipment.name: Core Equipment
items: Emergency energy gel (with magnesium + vitamin B6)

discreetGuide.title: Discreet Usage Guide
tips: Heat patch excuse: "Using heat pad for neck and shoulder pain"
Emergency exit phrase: "Need to handle urgent client email"

pelvicClock.name: Chair Pelvic Clock Movement
pelvicClock.description: Relieves sacroiliac joint pressure, improves lower back circulation
steps: Sit on edge of chair, feet flat on floor
Imagine pelvis as clock, slowly draw circles
Do one set clockwise and counterclockwise

footMassage.name: Hidden Foot Massage
footMassage.description: Use under-desk fascia ball to promote lower limb blood return
steps: Place small massage ball under desk
Remove shoes, roll ball with sole of foot
Focus on arch and heel areas

sideStretch.name: Side Waist Stretch by Water Cooler
sideStretch.description: Natural standing position, relieves waist tension
steps: Stand by water cooler, feet shoulder-width apart
One hand on waist, other arm stretch up
Bend body to one side, feel side waist stretch

breakfast.benefits: Provides sustained energy, stabilizes blood sugar

morningTea.foods: Red date tea or rose tea

lunch.foods: Lean meat + dark green vegetables + brown rice
lunch.benefits: Iron and fiber supplement, prevents anemia

coldDrinks.name: Cold drinks:
coldDrinks.items: Iced coffee, cold drinks, ice water

communication.title: Communication Template Assistant
communication.description: Effective communication with people around you during menstrual discomfort. These templates help you better express needs and seek understanding.

notification.template: "Honey, I'm not feeling well today and might need more rest. If I seem uncomfortable, please don't worry."

seekingUnderstanding.template: "I'm experiencing some pain and my emotions might fluctuate. Can you understand and give me some time and space? I'll recover soon."

rescheduling.template: "Sorry, I'm not feeling well today and might not be at my best. Can we reschedule? I'll make it up to you!"

partyParticipation.template: "I might come to the party but may need to leave early. If I look tired, please understand."

leaveRequest.template: "Hello, I'm not feeling well today and may need to take half a day off to address health issues. I'll handle other matters as soon as possible."

workAdjustment.template: "Sorry, I'm feeling unwell today and my work efficiency might be affected. Please prioritize urgent matters, and I'll complete other tasks as soon as possible."

acupressure.title: Office Acupressure Points
acupressure.description: Simple acupressure techniques that can be done discreetly in the office to quickly relieve pain and discomfort.

hegu.name: Hegu Point
hegu.location: Tiger mouth area, between thumb and index finger
hegu.benefits: Soothes liver qi, promotes blood circulation, relieves general pain
hegu.technique: Press with thumb pad, moderate pressure, 30 seconds each time
hegu.officeUse: Can be done discreetly during meetings without drawing attention

sanyinjiao.name: Sanyinjiao Point
sanyinjiao.location: Inner side of lower leg, three fingers above ankle
sanyinjiao.benefits: Regulates qi and blood, specifically relieves gynecological pain
sanyinjiao.technique: Press with thumb, coordinate with deep breathing, 1-2 minutes each time
sanyinjiao.officeUse: Can be done under desk, better effect when shoes are removed

scientificBasis.title: Scientific Basis
scientificBasis.content: Acupressure works by stimulating specific nerve points, promoting endorphin release, which are the body's natural painkillers. Modern research shows that appropriate acupoint stimulation can regulate nerve conduction and relieve pain perception.

batchProcessed.healthGuide_痛经Dy: Dysmenorrhea refers to lower abdominal pain, cramping, or discomfort that occurs during or around menstruation. It is one of the most common gynecological symptoms, affecting approximately 80% of women of reproductive age worldwide.
batchProcessed.healthGuide_痛经的严: The severity of menstrual pain varies from person to person, ranging from mild discomfort to severe pain that significantly impacts daily life. Understanding the nature of menstrual pain is the first step in developing effective management strategies.
batchProcessed.healthGuide_原发性痛: Primary dysmenorrhea is the most common type, usually appearing shortly after the onset of puberty. This pain is caused by uterine contractions and has no underlying pathological cause.
batchProcessed.healthGuide_通常在月: Usually appears 1-2 days before menstruation begins
batchProcessed.healthGuide_疼痛集中: Pain concentrated in lower abdomen and lower back
batchProcessed.healthGuide_可能伴有恶心呕吐腹泻: May be accompanied by nausea, vomiting, diarrhea
batchProcessed.healthGuide_继发性痛: Secondary dysmenorrhea is caused by underlying gynecological conditions, usually appearing in adulthood or when existing pain suddenly worsens. Requires medical evaluation and treatment.
batchProcessed.healthGuide_前列腺素: Prostaglandins are the primary biochemical factors causing menstrual pain. During menstruation, the endometrium releases large amounts of prostaglandins, particularly PGF2α and PGE2, which cause strong uterine muscle contractions, compress blood vessels, reduce blood flow, and thus generate pain.
batchProcessed.healthGuide_痛经的疼: Menstrual pain signals are transmitted through the sympathetic nervous system to the spinal cord and then to the brain. This process involves multiple neurotransmitters and receptors, including endorphins and serotonin, which explains why certain treatments (such as exercise and meditation) can effectively relieve pain.

batchProcessed.common_痛经Dy: Dysmenorrhea is one of the most common gynecological symptoms, with almost every woman experiencing it at some stage of life. However, many people lack in-depth understanding of the physiological mechanisms of dysmenorrhea, which often leads to inappropriate treatment choices or delays. This article will provide a detailed analysis of the mechanisms, classification standards, and characteristics of different types of dysmenorrhea from a medical perspective, providing you with a scientific theoretical foundation.
batchProcessed.common_痛经的分: Classification of Dysmenorrhea: Primary vs Secondary
batchProcessed.common_可能伴随其他症状: May be accompanied by other symptoms
batchProcessed.common_PGF2: PGF2α causes strong uterine muscle contractions, compressing blood vessels and causing uterine ischemia and hypoxia.
batchProcessed.common_缺血缺氧: Ischemia and hypoxia activate pain receptors, producing spasmodic pain.
batchProcessed.common_为什么有: Why do some women experience more severe dysmenorrhea?
batchProcessed.common_研究表明: Studies show that women with severe dysmenorrhea have 2-7 times higher prostaglandin concentrations in menstrual blood than women without dysmenorrhea. Additionally, individual sensitivity to prostaglandins, uterine contractility, and pain threshold all affect the severity of dysmenorrhea.
batchProcessed.common_子宫内膜: Endometrial tissue grows outside the uterus
batchProcessed.common_子宫肌肉层的良性肿瘤: Benign tumors in the uterine muscle layer
batchProcessed.common_子宫内膜侵入子宫肌层: Endometrium invades the uterine muscle layer
batchProcessed.common_非甾体抗: NSAIDs such as ibuprofen, naproxen, etc.
batchProcessed.common_热敷按摩: Heat therapy, massage, calcium channel blockers, etc.
batchProcessed.common_疼痛严重: Pain severely affects daily life and work
batchProcessed.common_伴随异常: Accompanied by abnormal bleeding, fever, or other symptoms
batchProcessed.common_25岁后: First occurrence of severe dysmenorrhea after age 25
batchProcessed.common_理解痛经: Understanding the physiological mechanisms of dysmenorrhea is the first step in scientific pain management. By distinguishing between primary and secondary dysmenorrhea, we can choose more targeted treatment methods. For primary dysmenorrhea, the focus is on inhibiting prostaglandin production and action; for secondary dysmenorrhea, underlying diseases need to be treated. Remember, severe dysmenorrhea is not normal, and timely medical consultation can achieve better treatment outcomes.

batchProcessed.common_的物质前: 的物质。前列腺素会引起子宫肌肉剧烈收缩，导致疼痛。
batchProcessed.common_而非甾体: 而非甾体抗炎药，简称NSAID，是缓解痛经的常用药物。它们能从源头减少前列腺素的产生。
batchProcessed.common_加载: 抱歉，视频加载失败。请检查您的网络连接或稍后再试。
batchProcessed.common_当您服下: 当您服下NSAID药片后，它会进入消化系统。
batchProcessed.common_然后通过: 然后通过消化道被吸收到血液里，随着血液流向全身。
batchProcessed.common_药物分子: 药物分子随着血液循环，最终抵达引起疼痛的部位——比如您的子宫周围。
batchProcessed.common_场景7作: 场景7：作用机制 - 抑制COX酶
batchProcessed.common_在这里N: 在这里，NSAID药物找到了产生前列腺素的关键
batchProcessed.common_环氧合酶: 环氧合酶的工作被打断，前列腺素的合成量就大大降低了。
batchProcessed.common_随着前列: 随着前列腺素减少，子宫收缩变得温和，疼痛感明显减轻。
batchProcessed.common_完成任务: 完成任务后，NSAID药物会被肝脏代谢，最终通过肾脏排出体外。
batchProcessed.common_这就是N: 这就是NSAID缓解痛经的完整过程：从服用到吸收，从作用到代谢，科学而有效。

batchProcessed.common_快速缓解: 快速缓解痛经的方法包括：热敷下腹部、适度运动、深呼吸练习、按摩腹部、服用非处方止痛药（如布洛芬）。热敷是最快速有效的方法之一。
batchProcessed.common_如果痛经: 如果痛经严重影响日常生活、疼痛持续时间长、伴有异常出血、发热或其他症状，应及时就医。医生可以帮助诊断是否存在潜在的妇科疾病。
batchProcessed.common_许多自然: 许多自然疗法如热敷、瑜伽、草药茶等都有科学研究支持其有效性。但效果因人而异，建议结合医学治疗使用。
